snippet: The United States and its allies differ on some intelligence estimates when it comes to chemical weapons use in Syria, but all agree that only the Assad government had the means to launch attacks.
abstract: United States and its allies differ on some intelligence estimates when it comes to chemical weapons use in Syria, but all agree that only Assad government has means to launch chemical attacks.

byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and ERIC SCHMITT
byline.contributor: Steven Erlanger contributed reporting from London.

lead_paragraph: The United States and its allies differ on some intelligence estimates when it comes to chemical weapons use in Syria, but all agree that only the Assad government had the means to launch attacks.

headline.main: Allies’ Intelligence Differs on Details, but Still Points to Assad Forces
headline.print_headline: Allies’ Intelligence Differs on Details, but Still Points to Assad Forces
